achieving crime control via incapacitation and deterrence

qas.question: What should be the main goal of not using punishment in a just system?

answers.text: would do more harm than good
whether it would do more harm than good
it focuses attention on the threat of punishment and not the moral reasons to follow this law
whether it would do more harm than good
whether it would do more harm than good.

qas.question: Who decides the fate of protesters most of the time?

answers.text: the state
judges
the state (including the judges)
the judges

qas.question: What should the punishment rely on instead in a just society?

qas.question: What is a major reason judges use morality against crime?
What does focusing on morality help a judge to achieve?
Who decides if a law is moral?

plausible_answers.text: whether it would do more harm than good

qas.question: What is the most important thing when deciding if a law is moral?
On what grounds is a law judged to be moral?

Nó là một vấn đề cho <a2_0><a2_2><b6_0> nhà nước <b6_0/><a2_0/> (kể cả <a2_3> các <a2_1><a2_4> ban giám khảo <a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_1/> ) <a2_2/> quyết định <b8_0> căn cứ tiện dụng <b8_0/> có nên làm như vậy hay không.
